oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of prostaglandin administration during the first hours after calving on blood calcium concentration in multiparous dairy cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Salgado-Hern√°ndez, E. G.
Bouda, J.
Aparicio-Cecilio, A.
Rendon Villamil, J.
Velasquez-Forero, F. H.
Castillo-Mata, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: subclinical hypocalcemia
metabolic
parturition
prostaglandin
uterine health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Subclinical hypocalcemia is a common metabolic disorder of dairy cows after parturition. The administration of prostaglandin (PGF2a) results in improvement of uterine health in some experiments, which may be explained by the effect of PGF2a on calcium and vitamin D metabolism.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 274
